intro: Capnites marschallianus, commonly known as the Marshall's capnites, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Capnites marschallianus is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
